The "Glossary A-D" is a comprehensive reference for terms related to gambling, covering entries from A to D. This glossary aims to provide clear definitions and explanations of various gambling-related terms, facilitating a better understanding of the industry and its terminology.

== Glossary of Terms A-D ==

=== A ===
; Action
: The total amount of money wagered in a specific period or on a particular event.
; Ante
: A small bet all players are required to make before a hand is dealt in poker.
; Arbitrage
: A betting strategy that involves placing bets on all possible outcomes of an event to guarantee a profit.

=== B ===
; Bankroll
: The total amount of money a player has set aside for gambling purposes.
; Bet
: A wager placed on the outcome of a game or event.
; Bookmaker
: An individual or organization that accepts bets on sporting and other events at agreed-upon odds.

=== C ===
; Casino
: A facility that houses and accommodates certain types of gambling activities.
; Chip
: A small disk used in casinos to represent money.
; Comp
: Complimentary items or services given to players by the casino.

=== D ===
; Dealer
: The person responsible for dealing cards and managing the game at a casino table.
; Double Down
: In blackjack, the option to double the initial bet in exchange for committing to stand after receiving one more card.
; Drop
: The total amount of money exchanged for chips at a casino table.
